header.#text:
Minimum wages,
				benefits, and working conditions

text.#text:
Each employer seeking to hire United States workers shall
				offer such workers not less than the same benefits, wages, and working
				conditions that the employer is offering, intends to offer, or will provide to
				H–2C workers. No job offer may impose on United States workers any restrictions
				or obligations which will not be imposed on the employer’s H–2C workers.

the services of
				workers to their employers and the employment opportunities afforded to workers
				by the employers, including those employment opportunities that require United
				States workers or H–2C workers to travel or relocate in order to accept or
				perform employment—

mutually benefit
				such workers, as well as their families, and employers; and

principally
				benefit neither employer nor employee; and

employment
				opportunities within the United States benefit the United States
				economy.

Every
				interpretation and determination made under this section or under any other
				law, regulation, or interpretative provision regarding the nature, scope, and
				timing of the provision of these and any other benefits, wages, and other terms
				and conditions of employment shall be made so that—

the prevailing wage level for the
				occupational classification in the area of employment; or

the applicable
				Federal, State, or local minimum wage, whichever is greatest.

header.#text:
Work
				authorization upon filing petition for extension of stay

text.#text:
The maximum continuous period of authorized status as an
				H–2C worker (including any extensions) is 18 months for a worker employed in a
				job that is of a temporary or seasonal nature. For an H–2C worker employed in a
				job that is not of a temporary or seasonal nature, the initial maximum
				continuous period of authorized status is 36 months and subsequent maximum
				continuous periods of authorized status are 18 months. There is no maximum

text.#text:
Any
			 H–2C worker may, as a condition of employment with an employer, be subject to
			 mandatory binding arbitration and mediation of any grievance relating to the
			 employment relationship. An employer shall provide any such worker with notice
			 of such condition of employment at the time the job offer is made.

Any cost associated with such arbitration and mediation
			 process shall be equally divided between the employer and the H–2C worker,
			 except that each party shall be responsible for the cost of its own counsel, if
			 any.

As
			 used in this section:

quote.#tail:
means a term, condition, obligation, or
			 requirement that is part of the job offer, such as the term of employment, the
			 job responsibilities, the employee conduct standards, and the grievance
			 resolution process, and to which an applicant or prospective H–2C worker must
			 consent or accept in order to be hired for the position.
